dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 5765 IH: Passports for Purple Hearts Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Levin (for himself, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mr. Peters, and Mrs. Radewagen) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To amend the Passport Act of 1920 to exempt from the collection of certain passport fees an individual who was awarded the Purple Heart, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Passports for Purple Hearts Act.

section.header: Exemption from certain passport fees of an individual who was awarded the Purple Heart
section.text: Section 1(a) of the Act of June 1, 1920 (22 U.S.C. 214; commonly referred to as the Passport Act of 1920) is amended in the third sentence, by inserting from an individual who was awarded the Purple Heart; before or from an individual or individuals abroad.
